posts.title: Grouping Posts
posts.content: Question on ability to group posts

replies.content:
Like folders that posts are put into

These are basically categories like "Games", "Extra Help", "Bugs", etc

Would that be helpful?

If a lot of people would like that, I could certainly do that.

Currently I have the forum style based on Reddit where it's like infinite scrolling down. I could also add like pages where each page had 20 posts and older posts might be on page 7 or something.
Or literally a reply to comment feature would be nice.
I think after one comment the whole question should be resolved so there is no overflow.
Not all answers are reliable. A reddit style (most upvotes) would be better, and this gives room for more opinions.

Ya I had the same idea to have a way to give a post a tag when posting it so that you could filter through, but after much deliberation Alen and I couldn't find a way to do it, so if you guys have any ideas on how to code a tag that you could filter by it would be great! However, we are still trying to find way to do it and it should be up and running in the next couple of weeks if we figure it out.
Good idea. Also there should be a report post/comment button to notfy us mods in case like we dont see it.

//It could be something like this: (Java)

import java.util.*;

class Main{

 static ArrayList<String> allTheMessages; //Arraylist containing all the messages

 static HashMap<String, LinkedList<String>> tags; //Map that maps each message to a linkedlist of tags

 public static ArrayList<String> returnTags(String query){ //When someone searches for a tag

ArrayList<String> messageReturn = new ArrayList<>();

 for(String i:allTheMessages){ //For loop that goes through all the messages when searching through a query

 for(String j:tags.get(i)){ //Loop that goes through all the tags of a given message

 if(j.equals(query)){

messageReturn.add(i);

 continue;

}

}

}

 return messageReturn;

}

}
that would most definitely help to sort out all conversations

posts.title: What is a unit of Independent/Dependent variables.
posts.content: Kgreatineedthis8ifiwantanintendoswitchplshelpkthxbye.

replies.content: Jeff- the unit depends upon whatever variable you choose. Per say, change in mass, that would be g. Please be more specific.

Also, this question has been asked and answered multiple times, but here you go-

Independent variable: millimeters (how much solvent)

Dependent variable: millimeters
Ultimately, he didn't specify which lab (Crit C or Crit B) so it could be for either lab
Like some of the variables dont even have units like brand of steel wool or time of evaluation or something
Sorry for spam but can an independent variable also be a controlled one?

Well, if you were controlling the independent variable nothing would change

You would just be measuring your surroundings, so it wouldn't be a "lab"
For example, if your lab was on "What colour absorbs the most light?" and you didn't change the colour, it would be pretty pointless
Jeff- the unit depends upon whatever variable you choose. Per say, change in mass, that would be g. Please be more specific.
For example, if your lab was on "What colour absorbs the most light?" and you didn't change the colour, it would be pretty pointless

posts.title: Please define Independent and Dependent variables. (For rust lab).
posts.content: K thx bye

replies.content:
Independent variables are ones that you manipulate and change

This would be the treatement you use

Dependent variables are what you're measuring

In this case it would be the height of the water in the pipette
Arthur you could have put that into one message- yes the dependant variable is essentially unchangeable.
Independent variables are ones that you manipulate and change
yes the dependant variable is essentially unchangeable.
Yes... as they said independent = the variables you purposely change (grade of steel, treatment etc.), the dependent is essentially the result. (change in mass (g), % surface rusted, colour, etc.)

The two main variables in an experiment are the independent and dependent variable. An independent variable is the variable that is changed or controlled in a scientific experiment to test the effects on the dependent variable. A dependent variable is the variable being tested and measured in a scientific experiment.

Hey Boys,

Welcome to the 2019-2020 CloudMates Platform available for all students attending Upper Canada College.

Our official domain is "cloudmates.ca" , so please use that to visit the platform. We are proud to provide all of you with daily weather, announcements, lunch menus, a place to talk and much more. Before using the Mentor section of this platform, please make sure to follow the General Rules and Guidelines. These rules are designed to make sure this platform is safe and fun for everyone.

Mentor Forum General Rules and Guidelines

  1. Swearing will be blocked, and there is no tolerance for avoidance.
  2. Respect all users using the platform.
  3. Absolutely NO bullying, discriminating, disrespecting, harassing, hating on another person or group
  4. Do not post content with the purpose of cheating points or beating the system.
  5. Do not post content inteded to mislead, lure, or shock users
  6. Respect all staff members in any scenario
  7. Do not post pornographic, sexually explicit, graphic, or otherwise NSFW content.
  8. Attempt not to share personal information of yourself or other students in the college
  9. Do not share your account passwords or other login credentials with other members
  10. Do not spam or promote spam anywhere on our site.
  11. Make sure your content and actions follows ALL rules of the Upper Canada College Technology Use Guidelines
  12. Do not try to hack or inject any features or components of the platform.

This site is for Educational and Student Life Efficiency purposes only, not a place to execute actions that are not permitted on school property, a complete list of these actions and their consequences will be in the UCC Family Handbook.
All staff members are here to regulate activity and provide support for all users of the site, staff members will not abuse or attempt to provide a specific advantage or harm to any individual. If you see a staff member not executing his duty, you may submit a report to alen.niu@ucc.on.ca . If you find any bugs or errors, you may also send an email to a member of the staff team and then if confirmed, you will receive a compensation. Once again, actions and content on this site must follow the UCC Technology Use and UCC Family Handbook Guidelines. If any of these rules (including UCC's) are violated, staff are given permissions to execute consequences. More serious violations will be reported to school administration.

Other than that, CloudMates is an amazing platform for all students to receieve help, relieve stress, and smoothen student life. In this forum you may post content regarding anything related to academics or school life (sports, events, music, arts, etc). You may ask for help or talk for any category as long as it follows the guidelines above. Points are awarded based on posted messages, replies and given away during events or assemblies.

We hope that you enjoy CloudMates and have fun while learning new things here. Other than that;

GO BLUES GO!!!

posts.title: REPLY TO THIS POST ONCE TO GET YOUR 50 POINT LOGIN BONUS
posts.content: Reply once to this post and you will receive 50 points bonus at the end of 24 hours.

replies.content:
Hey Boys,

Welcome to CloudMates Season 2 Whole School Launch. This season will end on the last assembly in December; winners will be receiving dollar value gift cards to a store of their choice.

How to use the site

  • Dashboard:
    • In the dashboard, you are able to see daily announcements, academic day, daily weather, current leaderboard standings and the weekly schedule.
  • Stewards Announcements:
    • In this page, you can see current stewards announcements posted by the school and/or Board of Stewards
  • Accounts
    • All students have an account that was pre-registered into the system. Your account information has been emailed to you, so simply click Login then type in the email and password you were given to enter the site. Once you have logged in, you may change the password to your desired password in "User Profile".
    • IIf the name you see in the top right corner or when you reply to posts is not the name you go by reguarly. Please email alen.niu@ucc.on.ca or info@cloudmates.ca to request a name change.
  • Landing Page:
    • This page will provide you links to UCC Managebac, PowerSchool, and the UCC athletics page. Simply click on the logo of any site to visit the website. If you are interested in further more specific links, click "Specific Links" and choose the place you want to go.
  • Lunch Menu:
    • Hungry? Well the weekly lunch menus for the UD and LD are posted in a very clear and effecient format. They are usually right; however, Aramark likes to switch things up so (not our fault) if it's wrong. ï¿½ï¿½
  • Mentor:
    • This is the forum page where you can answer or ask any questions related to school with fellow boys from any grades. This is meant to be a collaborative effort to help students engage with the UCC community and strive to learn new things and help.
    • You must be logged in to post or reply on the forum. You can see if you are logged in by looking at the top right corner.
    • Newest made posts will be at the top with the exception of IMPORTANT posts. Your posts will be time stamped and the replies count will show beside your post.
    • If you believe your question answered, you may click the three dots beside your post to mark it as resolved.
    • Within a specific post, all users have a profile card that will show their full name, roles, reply date, points and levels. Moderators will have a yellow MOD Tag and are able to remove posts/replies.
    • At the bottom of all the replies is an editor fully equipped with editing styles like Google Docs. You can change colors, add images, add links, add emojies even, and other things as well.
    • Every post will reward you 5 points and every reply will reward you 10. If a moderator removes your post/reply you will lose 15 so please dont post innapropriate content or spam.
    • If something seems or your points did not increase. Just refresh the page, and everything should be fine.
  • Notifications:
    • Notifications occur when a user has replied to a post you have created.
    • You will see a red number beside the notification tab indicating how many UNREAD notifcations you have. To read these notifcations; click the Notifications tab and click the notification you have not seen yet. This will take you to the reply made on your post and your notification number will decrease by 1.
    • All previous notifcations will still be on the page so you can view your previous notifications.
  • Community Service:
    • This is a community service calendar with inputs from the CS council about upcoming community service opportunites and events. The calendar will include dates, times, more information and links when you view an event. You may also add any specific event to your calendar by clicking add to my calendar. This will be updated frequently.
  • Houses:
    • Join your House and your head of house will be able to post house announcements, information and images.


IF any errors or bugs occur, do not hesitiate to send an email to any member of the CloudMates Moderation Team and Comittee.

Have Fun ï¿½ï¿½

IF any errors or bugs occur, do not hesitiate to send an email to any member of the CloudMates Moderation Team and Comittee.

Have Fun ï¿½ï¿½

Hey Boys,

Welcome to CloudMates Season 2 Whole School Launch. This season will end on the last assembly in December; winners will be receiving dollar value gift cards to a store of their choice.

How to use the site

  • Dashboard:
    • In the dashboard, you are able to see daily announcements, academic day, daily weather, current leaderboard standings and the weekly schedule.
  • Stewards Announcements:
    • In this page, you can see current stewards announcements posted by the school and/or Board of Stewards
  • Accounts
    • All students have an account that was pre-registered into the system. Your account information has been emailed to you, so simply click Login then type in the email and password you were given to enter the site. Once you have logged in, you may change the password to your desired password in "User Profile".
    • IIf the name you see in the top right corner or when you reply to posts is not the name you go by reguarly. Please email alen.niu@ucc.on.ca or info@cloudmates.ca to request a name change.
  • Landing Page:
    • This page will provide you links to UCC Managebac, PowerSchool, and the UCC athletics page. Simply click on the logo of any site to visit the website. If you are interested in further more specific links, click "Specific Links" and choose the place you want to go.
  • Lunch Menu:
    • Hungry? Well the weekly lunch menus for the UD and LD are posted in a very clear and effecient format. They are usually right; however, Aramark likes to switch things up so (not our fault) if it's wrong. ï¿½ï¿½
  • Mentor:
    • This is the forum page where you can answer or ask any questions related to school with fellow boys from any grades. This is meant to be a collaborative effort to help students engage with the UCC community and strive to learn new things and help.
    • You must be logged in to post or reply on the forum. You can see if you are logged in by looking at the top right corner.
    • Newest made posts will be at the top with the exception of IMPORTANT posts. Your posts will be time stamped and the replies count will show beside your post.
    • If you believe your question answered, you may click the three dots beside your post to mark it as resolved.
    • Within a specific post, all users have a profile card that will show their full name, roles, reply date, points and levels. Moderators will have a yellow MOD Tag and are able to remove posts/replies.
    • At the bottom of all the replies is an editor fully equipped with editing styles like Google Docs. You can change colors, add images, add links, add emojies even, and other things as well.
    • Every post will reward you 5 points and every reply will reward you 10. If a moderator removes your post/reply you will lose 15 so please dont post innapropriate content or spam.
    • If something seems or your points did not increase. Just refresh the page, and everything should be fine.
  • Notifications:
    • Notifications occur when a user has replied to a post you have created.
    • You will see a red number beside the notification tab indicating how many UNREAD notifcations you have. To read these notifcations; click the Notifications tab and click the notification you have not seen yet. This will take you to the reply made on your post and your notification number will decrease by 1.
    • All previous notifcations will still be on the page so you can view your previous notifications.
  • Community Service:
    • This is a community service calendar with inputs from the CS council about upcoming community service opportunites and events. The calendar will include dates, times, more information and links when you view an event. You may also add any specific event to your calendar by clicking add to my calendar. This will be updated frequently.
  • Houses:
    • Join your House and your head of house will be able to post house announcements, information and images.


IF any errors or bugs occur, do not hesitiate to send an email to any member of the CloudMates Moderation Team and Comittee.

posts.content:
Hey Boys, Welcome to the site.
Replying to this post in the next 24 hours from assembly will give your 50 points login bonus promised at the end of the 24 hours. After 24 hours has past, all replied users will have 50 points added to their account.

replies.content: I would love 50 points please and thank you

Please only post once! Any extra would be removed.

Thank you,

Jeffrey
That's because Alen has not given you 50 points yet. You get 10 points per post.

Ok, before you begin to spam questions,

You get 10 points per post. ALEN WILL GIVE YOU 50 POINTS LATER, NOT NOW. PLEASE DON'T ASK QUESTIONS. YOU GET 10 POINTS EVERY TIME YOU POST BUT DONT SPAM TO GET POINTS.

Re: Another question as well, were can we see the amount of points we have?

Under the User profile page, I just checked again and found it hope some one else can find this useful.

When you see your own post, there should be a box on the left with your stuff that says who posts. There is a maple leaf, and beside the maple leaf there is a number on the right. The number is how many points you have.
What does the crown represent? Number of posts?
Replies after this will be deleted

Children of Bodom

The night of timeless fire is drawing near
I flee, throughout the years of throe
Watching through a mirror, as I fall apart
I see a wreck, I'm burning

I see angels burning, falling down in ruins
Looking down I see me, I'm my own enemy

Watching myself decaying, falling from high spirits
I flee, throughout the ruins of me
Longing for finding my way out
Leaving myself, there's nothing left for me
The ruins are about to crumble down.

The flame is dying by shivery winds of jet black skies
It reflects hatred in my eyes

I see angels burning, falling down in ruins
Looking down I see my ashes scattered around my grave

Angels whispering fire, no longer I'm alive
Settled down I'm done with the trip to my kingdom come

S2ting by grade is now HERE!!

Thank you all for being patient but now, students can post to a specific Grade level when pressing the Create New Post button, simply select the drop-down and post to a specific grade or ALL.

Automatically, all posts will fall under the ALL forum where the default page will be, posts that are posted to a specific grade level will also show on the ALL page however in the top right of the forum. posts.title: Mods
posts.content: Jeff and Caleb are you the mods for the cloudmates app and do you run it?

replies.content: This was answered in a previous post. Jeff and Caleb are the mods along with a few other people. Check the post: "How does one achieve moderator status" and scroll down. Look for Alen Niu's comment.

Jeffrey and I are not the only Y8 mods. The other mods are Dean Francis, Pierce Lapham, and Dhruv Sharma. This website is not run by us but by Alen and possibly Dhruv. Mod applications may be sent out as we progress through the year.
Our job is to make sure that all the posts and replies follow the community guidelines.
Please don't say things like "thank you" or "oh ok" as it will be removed and you will lose 5 points.
Just to clarify, when one of our posts gets removed, we lose the 10 points for posting and 5 more points, or do we lose only 5?
Yes, you lose the points you gained from the post and an additional 5 points, so you can technically have a negative score.

posts.title: Removing your own post
posts.content: I accidentally had a typo in my reply and I removed my own post to fix my mistake, but I had lost points. Do you lose points for removing your own posts?

replies.content: I would avoid removing your own posts for now.
Yeah, any post or reply that was removed, you will lose points. This prevents people from spamming like 100 messages to gain points and then deleting them all while losing no points.
Yeah, try not to make any mistake and if it is simply a typo, then let it go.

posts.content: Does anyone know how many words the summary of all the battles should be?

replies.content: I'm pretty sure it's a 1K8, word essay

For each battle, it is a two-page summary covering :

Battle generalities (casualties, generals, tactics, improvements in technology) 

Battle highlights

Impact in the war

Canadian impact

Then as a group, you will write a max 1000 word essay on whether Canada deserves the title: Masters of War.

posts.title: Design Brief
posts.content: Does anybody know how to create a design brief for design courses? If so, please explain and give an example. Thanks

replies.content: Write the 5Ws and then add an intro.

posts.title: Design Brief
posts.content: Does anybody know how to create a design brief for design courses? If so, please explain and give an example. Thanks

replies.content: Write the 5Ws and then add an intro.

Here's the example slide from Coding:

Develop a design brief for your design challenge. Write a few sentences that include the following: A description of your problem, the needs of your client, and how your product might solve this problem. If you have a product in mind do not describe your product yet, we will do that in part 2.

As a designer, I will design and create a product thatâ€¦.



Sample Design brief: As we become more technologically advanced, we produce materials that can withstand extreme temperatures, are durable and easy to use. Plastic bags, plastic bottles, cans, and computer hardware are some of the things that make life easy for us but what we forget is that these advanced products do not break down naturally when we dispose them. The air, moisture, climate, or soil cannot break them down naturally. They are not biodegradable. As a designer, I will create a new product using the waste that can benefit humankind and the environment. I will create a documentary to inform the public about my discovery and design. 

Here's what you'll be evaluated on: (7/8 band)

  1. Explains and justifies the need for a solution for a familiar group of people.
  2. Constructs a research plan which states and prioritizes the research needed to develop a solution to the problem independently
  3. Analyses a group of similar products that inspire a solution to the problem presents the analysis of the findings from a range of sources, related to the development of a possible solution, cited appropriately.

Sample Design brief: As we become more technologically advanced, we produce materials that can withstand extreme temperatures, are durable and easy to use. Plastic bags, plastic bottles, cans, and computer hardware are some of the things that make life easy for us but what we forget is that these advanced products do not break down naturally when we dispose them. The air, moisture, climate, or soil cannot break them down naturally. They are not biodegradable. As a designer, I will create a new product using the waste that can benefit humankind and the environment. I will create a documentary to inform the public about my discovery and design. 

Here's what you'll be evaluated on: (7/8 band)

  1. Explains and justifies the need for a solution for a familiar group of people.
  2. Constructs a research plan which states and prioritizes the research needed to develop a solution to the problem independently
  3. Analyses a group of similar products that inspire a solution to the problem presents the analysis of the findings from a range of sources, related to the development of a possible solution, cited appropriately.
You're very welcome Yusuf. Also, I noticed you were in a thread from a while ago about marking a thread as SOLVED. Could you tell me how to do that as I can't find any buttons or options to mark it.

posts.title: Spam
posts.content:
Hi guys,

Please try to limit the spam in this forum. It is a lot of work for the mods to go over the inordinate amounts of posts and delete the unnecessary ones. Also, please try to keep all of your words in 1 post instead of spreading it across 100 of them just to get more points.  Yes, there are a few bugs, but we will fix these. Colour

Solution
soaking steel wool:

Preventative
treatments:

posts.title: Rust Lab Independent and Dependent Variables? (Mohtadi Only)
posts.content: Does anyone know what the variables for the rust lab are?

replies.content: Independent variables: This is basically the solvents that we are using
Dependent variables is basically what you're measuring. In this case, it's the water level on the pipette
I need help with the units though; no idea what the units are for the independent variable
Dependent might be the setting an/or the conditions of the placed stored
Unsure. I believe Mid November - something around the 15th or the 16th
sorry for spam - it depends what class your in because they have different due dates
a independant variable is a variable (often denoted by x ) whose variation does not depend on that of another.
a dependant is a variable (often denoted by y ) whose value depends on that of another.
a constant is a variable whose value cannot be changed once it has been assigned a value.

posts.title: Where do Demographers typically work in Canada? (Mohtadi)
posts.content: Where do Demographers typically work in Canada?

replies.content: Don't Demographers work all over Canada? I can't find a typical place where they would work.Â

I specifically put Mohtadi so that everyone would know that this thread is for students in Mohtadi ONLY. There is no need to comment if you are not in my class. Commenting like this on threads makes it harder to find real posts with actual answers.
They typically work inside of bigger cities because of larger populations
a demographer is an expert in the study of statistics relating to the changing structure of human populations
Demography is the study of population in a specific reigion

We're getting off topic here. 

WHERE do Demographers typically work in Canada?
an expert in the study of statistics relating to the changing structure of human populations.
Anywhere with a dense population (ie cities, towns, provinces etc.)

We're getting off-topic here.Â 

WHERE do Demographers typically work in Canada?Â 

I'm not asking for "who are demographers," "what do they do," or "who they work for."

in Canada that would be places like:

-Toronto

-Ottawa

-Montral etc..
^agree with Quincy, demographers work where they're needed
This question is like "Where do most teachers work?" or "Where are McDonalds in Canada?" -All over the place

Got this definition from Geo class for anyone still wondering - Demographers study people and populations, therefore, it is reasonable to assume they live in the urbanized parts or cities of Canada. More people will equal more demographers but smaller groups of individuals may live in and help develop more rural communities.

Demography is the statistical study of populations, especially human beings. Demography encompasses the study of the size, structure, and distribution of these populations, and spatial or temporal changes in them in response to birth, migration, aging, and death.

posts.title: Lose points
posts.content: Why do you suddenly lose 100 points for no reason

replies.content: You can only lose points if you have posted inappropriate or mod flagged content. If this is not the case, I suggest you contact our support team at support@cloudmates.ca
If you kept writing spam, it was probably deleted by a moderator. Make sure all your comments are constructive and helpful, not just for points.

Well if your posts or replies you posted before were completely irrelevant or flagged as "spammy" meaning posting multiple unnecessary replies continuously. 

The moderators are told to remove these kinds of posts/replies and thus you will lose -15 points while only gaining +10 points for a reply. Resulting in a -5 Net loss of points. 

If you believe that your replies are actually helpful and removed for no reason, you can just send me an email.

ðŸ˜

I have a question. Why did I when i was at 60 points, go down by 5 points to 55. First of all, it doesnt even make sense because I would have had to go down by 15 or 10 points and I also dont know why i went down points in the first place because I dont write any spams and I actually try to help like when I emailed Alen and told everyone else the answer. Also, I feel like although there are many people who spam, like by just saying idk or things like thanks or repeating something that was said already like 10 times, but I feel like the mods are unfair sometimes and delete things that are not spam. Lastly, just to for a question, what if by some chance, a mod sends something spammy or unnecessary, are they able be able to be deducted points?

Every time a post is removed by a mod, you lose all of the post points as well as 5 extra deducted points. Just don't end up like me...

ðŸ¤”
I have lost 65 points and I don't really know why. Is there any way of me finding out? If not, I think you guys should make one.
If you are looking for answers about your point loses it can typically be answered by moderators or Alen Niu, the admin
There is a lot of comments that add nothing to the conversation, like "Good Point" or "Ok thanks" done just for the points.
Like Jake said if you have any questions about the point system email Alen or email info@cloudmates.ca and they will both help!

posts.title: Design Triff
posts.content: Questions relation to design

replies.content:
In general, dimensions include:

The bottom has to be off the ground (Higher than the fishing hook), 2-5cm height range for launcher

No minimum (except for cartridge, 3cmx6cm)

Maximum: Has to fit within your drawer

GO TO MS. TRIFF'S WEBSITE TO FIND OUT. You don't have to ask 100 questions. You can find everything here: https://sites.google.com/ucc.on.ca/triffyear8design/product-dragster-challenge/developing-ideas

Based on the competition rules previously published a Dragster fit for competition must:

SIZE / SIGNIFICANT DIMENSIONS

  • not exceed any of these maximum dimensions: L 42 cm x W 30.75 cm x H 15.5 cm (the size of your storage drawer)
  • have an underbody/chassis clearance a minimum of 1.0 cm above the track (accounting for axel position and guide-wire eyelet clearance)
  • have the centre of the CO2 cartridge located 2.5 cm - 5 cm above the track to fit in the starting gate

â€‹TOOLS + MATERIALS

  • include a significant LASER CUT part designed by you and made with at least one of these materials: cardboard sheet, acrylic sheet, or wood sheet
  • include a 3D printed part designed by you and made with one of the plastic filaments provided in class (part must be printable in under an hour)
  • use the axles and wheels provided (or you may design your own)
  • have two guide-wire eyelets secured to the underbody / chassis (one toward the front of the car, one toward the rear of the car)

FORM + APPEARANCE

  • be well crafted in terms of appearance, precision, fit & finish
  • follow the basic principles of aerodynamic design
  • utilize the inherent colours of the materials selected in a considered aesthetic manner
  • not use excess paint, or modelling compounds
The criterion b is due next week sunday
You have to finish your orthographic as well as your design breif for your chosen design
the orthographic isnt due till next week

Nope, for Mr. Mohtadi's form it's due today, unless it's different for your form.

I'm sure she would have it be consistent for all the classes, she literally told us that since we were behind we would have less time to do it

And I quote from her,

Brittney Triff Wednesday, Oct 30, 2019 at 11:24 AM

Developing Ideas Criterion Due

This is a reminder that your Developing Ideas is due this Sunday. Take a look at my website for specifics. You will submit your thumbnail sketches, your 2 TinkerCAD models, a paragraph justifying what design you prefer and why, and your orthographic of that preferred model.
It was due yesterday for Krstich's class

In general, dimensions include:

The bottom has to be off the ground (Higher than the fishing hook), 2-5cm height range for launcher

No minimum (except for cartridge, 3cmx6cm)

Maximum: Has to fit within your drawer

replies.content: we have a test review that we can use
I am confused about the first things that we learned (chemical properties- density etc...
Yep, Mr. Bruce/Your science teacher should have posted a review on Managebac that you can use
what is the difference between chemical and physical properties?

"The general properties of matter such as color, density, hardness, are examples of physical properties. Properties that describe how a substance changes into a completely different substance are called chemical properties. Flammability and corrosion/oxidation resistance are examples of chemical properties."
Â â€Â Â â€Â Â â€Â Â â€Â

How do atoms gain and lose electrons?

How do elements form a full valence shell?

How do you find the number of neutrons, electrons, and protons for a certain element?

Yusuf,

More electronegative atoms pull electrons from lesse electronegative ones.

A full valence shell is when the outer shell can hold no more electrons.

Protons is the atomic number. Neutrons is mass minus number. Electrons is the same as protons unless it is an ion. Each electron more than the number of protons decreases the charge by 1.

posts.title: Mods and Support only reply once
posts.content: Sometimes I want to follow up with Alen or other mods once they have responded. I can't get them to reply again because they aren't notified of my new posting addressed to them. Is there a way to notify mods that the issue is unresolved or that you need more help? Thanks!

replies.content: Also what does the red progress bar mean in the leaderboard? Why do people with the same points have different progress bar indicators.

Actually everybody gets notified once anyone replys to any thread that they are involved in. However, this feature is also not out yet. The staff typically check the website many times a day so getting help from mods/admin should not be a problem.

posts.title: Profanity Policy
posts.content: what are the rules regarding swearing, and how do mods moderate inappropriate posts.

replies.content: No swearing for NSFW posts whatsover. Mods will remove the posts without notice which will result in -15 points. Look at the general rules and guidlines at the top of the mentor page
Just mentioning because I noticed an older post titled "**** Math help". Might need to check that out
I completely agree with keeping it PG
Alright, I'll notify Alen of the profane post. Thanks for letting me know

To my understanding, the policy is No: 

Swearing 

Bullying, Harassing or Hazing, etc. towards other users 

Pornographic, sexually explicit, graphic, or otherwise NSFW content.

See more in the 'General Rules and Guidelines' post at the top of the page.

replies.content: I believe it refers to cloudmates switching from closed to a certain group to open for all students. I think a way to get rid of the banner might be a good idea if certain people don't like it.
Season 2 is the second iteration of the site as it was previously released only for Grade 8's. This also references the score counter as this was reset after this was released to the whole school.
Season 2 is the second release of Cloudmates. Season 1 was for y8s only. Season 2 will end once the gift cards are handed out at the last assembly in December
Seeing as Grade 12s are off of school for exams relatively soon (wednesday the 4th) which assembly will gift cards be handed out?

posts.title: Suggestion
posts.content: Not all posts are getting marked as resolved even if they are resolved, and I think this is causing confusion. Maybe if we allowed the poster and the mods to mark as resolved this would solve the problem? Or is this already a thing?

replies.content: You can actually mark as resolved by yourself. Alen, have you enabled it for the users?

Alen has talked about three dots for resolving posts however I don't see them. I think this is a great solution as most conversations have been answered and are taking up space devoted to queries that need answering.

when they were enabled for the y8 launch, it didn't seem too useful. But if you think they are, I'll enable them again for the next update.

ðŸ˜ˆ
The three dots resolve the post. Others have had similar problems; it's being fixed

posts.title: Suggestion
posts.content: I think there needs to be a better way to make sure posts end up in the correct category. For example, last time I posted a suggestion, I forgot to tag it as a suggestion, which meant it just ended up in the general category, which is getting crowded. I just think that most posts are just ending up in the All category as people gloss over the category selection.

replies.content: Maybe after one day all posts can be deleted so it's not as crowded.

posts.title: Shouldn't lose points for deleting own post
posts.content: I don't think you should lose points if you voluntarily remove your own comment.

replies.content: I am aware the reason for this handicap is to prevent people from scamming the system to quickly earn points and then subsequently delete them; not providing any benefit to the discussion.
But the thing is if I want to make an edit, I have to delete and repost, which causes one to lose points

posts.title: Shouldn't lose points for deleting own post

replies.content: I am aware the reason for this handicap is to prevent people from scamming the system to quickly earn points and then subsequently delete them; not providing any benefit to the discussion.
But the thing is if I want to make an edit, I have to delete and repost, which causes one to lose points
I agree and am sometimes annoyed at this fact. I think making an edit button instead of a delete button would be a better solution. Plus the "empty" posts would then be a flag for moderators.

posts.title: Y12 Math
posts.content: What is the difference beween binomial pdf and cdf on your calculator?

posts.title: Y12 Math
posts.content: What is the difference beween binomial pdf and cdf on your calculator?

replies.content: for normal distribution, pdf indicates that you are looking for a single value while cdf shows that you are looking for a range. For binomial it is the same thing but we are not required to look for a range of values, thus we will only be needed to use binomialpdf on the upcoming exam.

posts.title: Can we please not spam unhelpful comments just to get points?
posts.content: I am sure that everyone is aware of the fact that, there does seem to be a lot of "mindless spam" in the comments of posts. I know we all want to get more points, but can we please do so in a helpful way? 5 comments saying "thanks a lot *OP's name" is clearly points farming, and is not helpful.  Also, the moderators are going around and deleting those comments, THIS WILL RESULT IN -15 POINTS for the commenter, so you will actually lose points. Be smart and stop "mindless spam" comments, it will make the mod's job easier, and plus, you don't get negative points.

posts.title: CloudMates is in DEVELOPMENT Phase until January 13th
posts.content: We have entered development phase until the week back from school. We have many security, features and other updates we would like to implement thus the site will be no longer making any major changes until the winter break.

replies.content:
I would advise checking the daily announcements and stewards announcements still, however other features will be in development. 

The forum page will still be live and points can still be gained but keep in mind useless posts will be removed. The point competition will end next Friday where I will announce the winners at assembly.

Good luck on tests and exams everybody. Have an amazing winter
Also, why do I get a TRACKER blocked notification from firefox. It seems that Facebook analytics is being used on the site to track users
Also, are there restrictions on mods being on the leaderboard because of their extra power to remove posts?
I don't believe there are restrictions on mods being on the leaderboard

Hey Boys,

Welcome to the 2019-2020 CloudMates Platform available for all students attending Upper Canada College.

Our official domain is "cloudmates.ca" , so please use that to visit the platform. We are proud to provide all of you with daily weather, announcements, lunch menus, a place to talk and much more. Before using the Mentor section of this platform, please make sure to follow the General Rules and Guidelines. These rules are designed to make sure this platform is safe and fun for everyone.

Mentor Forum General Rules and Guidelines

  1. Swearing will be blocked, and there is no tolerance for avoidance.
  2. Respect all users using the platform.
  3. Absolutely NO bullying, discriminating, disrespecting, harassing, hating on another person or group
  4. Do not post content with the purpose of cheating points or beating the system.
  5. Do not post content inteded to mislead, lure, or shock users
  6. Respect all staff members in any scenario
  7. Do not post pornographic, sexually explicit, graphic, or otherwise NSFW content.
  8. Attempt not to share personal information of yourself or other students in the college
  9. Do not share your account passwords or other login credentials with other members
  10. Do not spam or promote spam anywhere on our site.
  11. Make sure your content and actions follows ALL rules of the Upper Canada College Technology Use Guidelines
  12. Do not try to hack or inject any features or components of the platform.

This site is for Educational and Student Life Efficiency purposes only, not a place to execute actions that are not permitted on school property, a complete list of these actions and their consequences will be in the SUCC Family Handbook.
All staff members are here to regulate activity and provide support for all users of the site, staff members will not abuse or attempt to provide a specific advantage or harm to any individual. If you see a staff member not executing his duty, you may submit a report to alen.niu@ucc.on.ca . If you find any bugs or errors, you may also send an email to a member of the staff team and then if confirmed, you will receive a compensation. Once again, actions and content on this site must follow the UCC Technology Use and UCC Family Handbook Guidelines. If any of these rules (including UCC's) are violated, staff are given permissions to execute consequences. More serious violations will be reported to school administration.

Other than that, CloudMates is an amazing platform for all students to receieve help, relieve stress, and smoothen student life. In this forum you may post content regarding anything related to academics or school life (sports, events, music, arts, etc). You may ask for help or talk for any category as long as it follows the guidelines above. Points are awarded based on posted messages, replies and given away during events or assemblies.

We hope that you enjoy CloudMates and have fun while learning new things here. Other than that;

GO BLUES GO!!!

replies.content:
Soting by grade is now HERE!!

Thank you all for being patient but now, students can post to a specific Grade level when pressing the Create New Post button, simply select the drop-down and post to a specific grade or ALL.

Automatically, all posts will fall under the ALL forum where the default page will be, posts that are posted to a specific grade level will also show on the ALL page however in the top right of the forum. You may select the drop-down and specify a specific grade level where it will only show that specific grade level posts.
Ayyy! Nice job, made searching posts much more easier
This is awesome. Looking forward to helping guys in the younger grades.
This helps a lot! Makes it easier to search through posts
I like this function seems cool. I think you should also add posting to a house so heads of house can put announcements here or something
